creator: tp@informationsdesign.de
text:
Hello,

Apache does not forward the rewritten request to the tomcat servlet engine, 
when session tracking is implemented via URLRewritting (setting 
noCookies="true" in the server.xml, or disabling cookies on the client) . 
Adding a JkMount /*;jsessionid=* or adding JkMount /*.jsp* does not do the job 
either. Many people in the user mailing list are having problems with it and 
nobody really has a simple solution. In my opinion this is very important to be 
support out of the box, since many people would like to set up Tomcat with 
Apache and cookies are not always the best solution.

creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com
text:
Seems like a serious problem in mod_jk. AFAIK the code did have support for
that, probably something is broken. I don't think this can be fixed for 
3.2.2, but you could use mod_jk from 3.3 ( after this is fixed )
*** Bug 1769 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com

text:
Handling for ";jsessionid=" is build into mod_jk and is currently working in
Tomcat 3.3.  No JkMount directives are needed.
